title: 47, looking for my wife and best friend
text:
The quick stuff. I'm shy, submissive, kinky, curvy, physically disabled, retired, not rich, have a teen son and two adult children, have cats and a dog, intelligent, a child at heart, nonsmoker, no drugs and nondrinker. Own a house and a car. Not in huge debt. No criminal or sexual disease history. 

What I'm looking for: Friends are great, but my end goal is a committed, permanent partnership. A wife. I am NOT interested in one night stands, friends with benefits, etc. I am not so fussed about race, colors, creeds, religions (although don't be a voodoo priestess or an evangelical), sizes, labels and so forth. Disabled, retired, is ok. If you've NEVER wanted to go to school or work or learn a skill, then likely we won't hit it off. Kids and pets are fine. No smokers, vapers ok. Some social drinking is ok, but if you do it often, we won't be happy together and I never want to see you drunk and obnoxious. Be dominant......not controlling, but decisive. You MUST be out. You must be a lesbian. No men, no couples, no trans now or in the plans. If you act like Bundy, no. Just, no. If you don't know who that is, then you are too young for me. No one under 35, preferably 40-60. Must love and not be allergic to kids and pets. Must like to travel. 

I live in Haltom City, so I was already thrown by "midcities, north dfw or fort worth" and nearly threw in the towel just at that. That should tell you, I'm a bit shy, submissive, tentative and need to be drawn out. If you are the type to show up and say "we are doing this today".....then you will get me to do it. If you call and say "what do you think you might want to do?".....I'll probably say "stay home."

I am a late in life lesbian, I was married to a man first. I have 3 children. The oldest two still live in my house until August/Sept, when they will be going to University. The youngest will just start high school next Fall. I know this is their mother talking, but they truly are exceptionally great kids. Honor roll kids, responsible, respectful, help out around the house, and like to do things with the family. As I stated, I am COMPLETELY out. I don't subscribe to the "don't tell the children, they are too young" theory. My youngest has known his mother is a lesbian since he was 5. 

I love children, and am a retired elementary school teacher. If you hate kids, I will not be happy in our relationship. 

I love animals, ALL kinds of animals (just insects are safer far away from me). I have 3 cats and a small dog, so if you don't like animals, I will not be happy in our relationship. 

I hate politics with a passion. That said, if you are a staunch republican and support that idiot front runner........you guessed it, I will not be happy in our relationship. 

I am socially aware, I believe in second chances and helping hands. I believe in charitable acts. I believe in smiles and hugs. I believe in making the world just a little happier each day of your life. If you think everyone needs to handle everything themselves and if they can't, then tough..........I will not be happy in our relationship. 

I am thirsty for knowledge. I am always looking for more and new things. I love museums, aquariums and zoos. I love to learn. I am always seeking input, either through life experience, a computer, a book or a television.....or just another person. I love to talk about anything and everything. I love humor, but not silly slapstick practical joke type stuff. Intelligent humor. Although I do admit, I have to watch Jingle All the Way and Home Alone every Christmas. I love plays, operas and the movies. I love love love to travel. I'm a bit Disney crazy, and I collect baby dolls and dollhouses. I adore history......not the facts, but the stories. If you don't like to learn, have nothing driving you....I will not be happy in our relationship. 

Unlike others on here, I DO want to exchange endless emails and skype texts.....it's fun to get to know someone! I love to talk to others. If you don't communicate, I will not be happy in our relationship. 

Physically, I am disabled. I can walk short distances without assistance, but need a walker or wheelchair for something long. I cannot lift much, nor turn bottle tops, etc. I use a shower chair as I get too tired. I have a lot of dr. visits. I was forced to retire early. I will not be your workout buddy. Some days I can't meet for dinner. Some days I can't do much of anything. I take a LOT of medication. My diseases will shorten my life, but I'm good for a few decades. :)

I do occasionally get down about my changing lifestyle due to the diseases. I do have a lot of pain. But I don't swear and rant and rave. I get a bit quiet, and maybe cry. I'm usually fine by the next day. 

I need you to handle your life difficulties much the same. Today you can feel bad, tomorrow shake it off. I simply will not function well with someone who is down a lot. 

I have no mental issues. I have no big social issues other than being a bit shy. I do not smoke, drink or do drugs. I would prefer you be the same, but if you aren't, please do be honest. I don't like surprises, not even good ones. 

I'm a bit chubby, and being in my late 40s, a bit saggy here and there. I don't have a lot of wrinkles in obvious places, but yeah, take the clothes off and you can tell I'm not 20. I have been losing weight over the last year or so, down about 80 lbs and back in a size 18. I'm proud of that. I'm trying to eat better, and succeeding unless I have to go out of town. 

I own a house and a nice car, but can not be anyone's sugar mama. Early retirement doesn't pay much. :)

I have brown hair and eyes. I'm white. Currently my hair is to my midback, but generally I keep it just off my shoulders. I dress comfortably, jeans and plain but feminine blouses, converses. title: 47, looking for my wife and best friend
text:
The quick stuff. I'm shy, submissive, kinky, curvy, physically disabled, retired, not rich, have a teen son and two adult children, have cats and a dog, intelligent, a child at heart, nonsmoker, no drugs and nondrinker. Own a house and a car. Not in huge debt. No criminal or sexual disease history. 

What I'm looking for: Friends are great, but my end goal is a committed, permanent partnership. A wife. I am NOT interested in one night stands, friends with benefits, etc. I am not so fussed about race, colors, creeds, religions (although don't be a voodoo priestess or an evangelical), sizes, labels and so forth. Disabled, retired, is ok. If you've NEVER wanted to go to school or work or learn a skill, then likely we won't hit it off. Kids and pets are fine. No smokers, vapers ok. Some social drinking is ok, but if you do it often, we won't be happy together and I never want to see you drunk and obnoxious. Be dominant......not controlling, but decisive. You MUST be out. You must be a lesbian. No men, no couples, no trans now or in the plans. If you act like Bundy, no. Just, no. If you don't know who that is, then you are too young for me. No one under 35, preferably 40-60. Must love and not be allergic to kids and pets. Must like to travel. 

I live in Haltom City, so I was already thrown by "midcities, north dfw or fort worth" and nearly threw in the towel just at that. That should tell you, I'm a bit shy, submissive, tentative and need to be drawn out. If you are the type to show up and say "we are doing this today".....then you will get me to do it. If you call and say "what do you think you might want to do?".....I'll probably say "stay home." 

I am completely out, and I would want you to be the same, so let's get that out of the way first. I went through coming out hell, and I refuse to go back in for ANY length of time, ANYwhere. That said, if you want to be discreet at work functions, I understand that. 

I am a late in life lesbian, I was married to a man first. I have 3 children. The oldest two still live in my house until August/Sept, when they will be going to University. The youngest will just start high school next Fall. I know this is their mother talking, but they truly are exceptionally great kids. Honor roll kids, responsible, respectful, help out around the house, and like to do things with the family. As I stated, I am COMPLETELY out. I don't subscribe to the "don't tell the children, they are too young" theory. My youngest has known his mother is a lesbian since he was 5. 

I love children, and am a retired elementary school teacher. If you hate kids, I will not be happy in our relationship. 

I love animals, ALL kinds of animals (just insects are safer far away from me). I have 3 cats and a small dog, so if you don't like animals, I will not be happy in our relationship. 

I hate politics with a passion. That said, if you are a staunch republican and support that idiot front runner........you guessed it, I will not be happy in our relationship. 

I am socially aware, I believe in second chances and helping hands. I believe in charitable acts. I believe in smiles and hugs. I believe in making the world just a little happier each day of your life. If you think everyone needs to handle everything themselves and if they can't, then tough..........I will not be happy in our relationship. 

I am thirsty for knowledge. I am always looking for more and new things. I love museums, aquariums and zoos. I love to learn. I am always seeking input, either through life experience, a computer, a book or a television.....or just another person. I love to talk about anything and everything. I love humor, but not silly slapstick practical joke type stuff. Intelligent humor. Although I do admit, I have to watch Jingle All the Way and Home Alone every Christmas. I love plays, operas and the movies. I love love love to travel. I'm a bit Disney crazy, and I collect baby dolls and dollhouses. I adore history......not the facts, but the stories. If you don't like to learn, have nothing driving you....I will not be happy in our relationship. 

Unlike others on here, I DO want to exchange endless emails and skype texts.....it's fun to get to know someone! I love to talk to others. If you don't communicate, I will not be happy in our relationship. 

Physically, I am disabled. I can walk short distances without assistance, but need a walker or wheelchair for something long. I cannot lift much, nor turn bottle tops, etc. I use a shower chair as I get too tired. I have a lot of dr. visits. I was forced to retire early. I will not be your workout buddy. Some days I can't meet for dinner. Some days I can't do much of anything. I take a LOT of medication. My diseases will shorten my life, but I'm good for a few decades. :)

I do occasionally get down about my changing lifestyle due to the diseases. I do have a lot of pain. But I don't swear and rant and rave. I get a bit quiet, and maybe cry. I'm usually fine by the next day.
